Module de.nicrizzos
Package de.nicrizzos.game.utils

Class SQLiteManager

java.lang.Object
de.nicrizzos.game.utils.SQLiteManager
public class SQLiteManager
extends java.lang.Object
Utility class for managing a database connection.
Version:
1.3
Author:
Pascal Staadt.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected java.sql.Connection connection
    The connection variable the SQLManager will be using

    SQLiteManager​(int _slot)
    Use this to create an SQLManager for the respective save slot.

      public SQLiteManager​(int _slot)

  • Method Details

    • startSQL

      public void startSQL()
      Establishes a connection to the respective save database.

    • stopSQL

      public void stopSQL()
      Terminates the connection to the SQL server; always use this when you're done using the database.

    • getConnection

      public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Fetch the SQLManager's current database connection.
      Returns:
      The current connection.
      See Also:
      Connection, DriverManager.getConnection(String)

    • executeWithResult

      public java.sql.ResultSet executeWithResult​(java.lang.String sql)
      Will execute an SQL statement and save the results for further enquiry.
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL query as a string literal.
      Returns:
      The query's results.
      See Also:
      ResultSet

    • executeUpdate

      public boolean executeUpdate​(java.lang.String sql)
      Will execute an SQL statement which does not expect a return value (e.g. update).
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL query as a string literal.
      Returns:
      Returns true, if everything went ok.

    • checkIfPlayerExists

      public boolean checkIfPlayerExists()
      Checks if a player exists in the database.
      Returns:
      True, if the database isn't empty.

    • getPlayerName

      public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
      Fetch the player's chosen name.
      Returns:
      The player's name.

    • deleteSave

      public void deleteSave()
      Dummy method, will later delete saves.

    • save

      public void save​(Player _player, java.lang.String _sceneID, java.lang.String _chapterID)
      Saves the player's current stats to the database.
      Parameters:
      _player - The player whose stats to use.
      _sceneID - Should be the current scene's ID.
      _chapterID - Should be the current chapter's ID.

      public void savePlayer​(Player _player)

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer​(java.lang.String _name)
      Will write the player's into the database.
      Parameters:
      _name - The player's name.

    • getStat

      public int getStat​(java.lang.String _stat)
      Searches the databases for this stat and returns and integer value. Returns 0, if empty or something goes wrong.
      Parameters:
      _stat - The stat to look for, represented as a string.
      Returns:
      The stat's value; 0, if empty or something goes wrong.
